anonymize_user_on_delete.description: Allows anonymizing users on destroy. Requires Sonarqube version >= 9.7.

tls_insecure_skip_verify.description: Allows ignoring insecure certificates when set to true. Defaults to false. Disabling TLS verification is dangerous and should only be done for local testing.

key.description: Unique key of the Azure Devops instance setting

block.description:
Provides a Sonarqube Azure Devops Alm/Devops Platform Integration resource. This can be used to create and manage a Alm/Devops
Platform Integration for Azure Devops.

client_id.description: GitHub App Client ID. Maximum length: 80

client_secret.description: GitHub App Client Secret. Maximum length: 160

key.description: Unique key of the GitHUb instance setting. Maximum length: 200

private_key.description: GitHub App private key. Maximum length: 2500

webhook_secret.description: GitHub App Webhook Secret. Maximum length: 160

block.description:
Provides a Sonarqube GitHub Alm/Devops Platform Integration resource. This can be used to create and manage a Alm/Devops
Platform Integration for GitHub.

key.description: Unique key of the GitLab instance setting. Maximum length: 200

personal_access_token.description: GitLab App personal access token with the `read_api` scope. See [this doc](https://docs.sonarqube.org/latest/devops-platform-integration/gitlab-integration/#importing-your-gitlab-projects-into-sonarqube) for more information. Maximum length: 2000

block.description:
Provides a Sonarqube GitLab Alm/Devops Platform Integration resource. This can be used to create and manage a Alm/Devops
Platform Integration for GitLab.

monorepo.description: Is this project part of a monorepo

block.description:
Provides a Sonarqube Azure Devops binding resource. This can be used to create and manage the binding between an
Azure Devops repository and a SonarQube project

monorepo.description: Is this project part of a monorepo. Default value: false

repository.description: The full name of your GitHub repository, including the organization, case-sensitive. Maximum length: 256

summary_comment_enabled.description: Enable/disable summary in PR discussion tab. Default value: true

block.description:
Provides a Sonarqube GitHub binding resource. This can be used to create and manage the binding between a
GitHub repository and a SonarQube project

monorepo.description: Is this project part of a monorepo. Default value: false

project.description: SonarQube project key. Changing this will force a new resource to be created

block.description:
Provides a Sonarqube GitLab binding resource. This can be used to create and manage the binding between a
GitLab repository and a SonarQube project

name.description: The name of the Group to create. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

block.description: Provides a Sonarqube Group resource. This can be used to create and manage Sonarqube Groups.

login_name.description: The `login_name` of the User to add as a member. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

name.description: The name of the Group to add a member to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

block.description: Provides a Sonarqube Group Member resource. This can be used to add or remove user to or from Sonarqube Groups.

branch.description: The name of a branch of a project for which the new code period will be configured. Changing this will force a new resource to be created. Setting this also requires setting the 'project' argument.

project.description: The key of a project for which the new code period will be configured. Changing this will force a new resource to be created.

type.description: The kind of new code period to use. Supported values are SPECIFIC_ANALYSIS, PREVIOUS_VERSION, NUMBER_OF_DAYS, or REFERENCE_BRANCH.

value.description: The desired value of the new code period. Varies based on the 'type'. For SPECIFIC_ANALYIS, the value must be the UUID of a previous analysis. For NUMBER_OF_DAYS it must be a numeric string. For REFERENCE_BRANCH it should be the name of branch on the project. For PREVIOUS_VERSION it must **not** be set.

block.description: Provides a Sonarqube New Code Periods resource. This can be used to manage Sonarqube New Code Periods.

default.description: Set the template as the default. This can only be set for one template.

name.description: The name of the Permission template to create. Do not use names with `/`. If needed, use `replace(var.permission_template_name, "/", "_")`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

project_key_pattern.description: The project key pattern. Must be a valid Java regular expression.

block.description:
Provides a Sonarqube Permission template resource. This can be used to create and manage Sonarqube Permission
templates.

group_name.description: The name of the Group that should get the specified permissions. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Cannot be used with `login_name`

login_name.description: The name of the user that should get the specified permissions. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Cannot be used with `group_name`.

permissions.description: A list of permissions that should be applied. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Possible values are: `admin`, `codeviewer`, `issueadmin`, `securityhotspotadmin`, `scan`, `user`.

project_key.description: Specify if you want to apply project level permissions. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Cannot be used with `template_id & template_name`

template_id.description: Specify if you want to apply the permissions to a permission template. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Cannot be used with `project_key & template_name`

template_name.description: Specify if you want to apply the permissions to a permission template. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Cannot be used with `project_key & template_id`

block.description: Provides a Sonarqube Permissions resource. This can be used to manage global and project permissions.

key.description: The key identifying the plugin to uninstall.

block.description: Provides a Sonarqube Plugin resource. This can be used to create and manage Sonarqube Plugins.

branch.description: Which branch to analyze. If nothing, or '' is specified, the main branch is used.

description.description: A description of the Portfolio to create

key.description: The key of the Portfolio to create

name.description: The name of the Portfolio to create

regexp.description: A regular expression that is used to match Projects with a matching name OR key. If they match, they are added to the Portfolio

selection_mode.description: How to populate the Portfolio to create. Possible values are `NONE`, `MANUAL`, `TAGS`, `REGEXP` or `REST`. [See docs](https://docs.sonarqube.org/9.8/project-administration/managing-portfolios/#populating-portfolios) for how Portfolio population works

tags.description: List of Project tags to populate the Portfolio from. Only active when `selection_mode` is `TAGS`

visibility.description: Whether the created portfolio should be visible to everyone, or only specific user/groups. If no visibility is specified, the default portfolio visibility will be `public`.

project_key.description: The project key of the project to add to the portfolio

selected_branches.description: A set of branches for the project to add to the portfolio

block.description: A set of projects to add to the portfolio.
Provides a Sonarqube Portfolio resource. This can be used to create and manage Sonarqube Portfolio. Note that the SonarQube API for Portfolios is called ``views``

name.description: The name of the Project to create

project.description: Key of the project. Maximum length 400. All letters, digits, dash, underscore, period or colon.

tags.description: A list of tags to put on the project.

visibility.description: Whether the created project should be visible to everyone, or only specific user/groups. If no visibility is specified, the default project visibility of the organization will be used. Valid values are `public` and `private`.

field_values.description: Setting field values for the supplied key

value.description: Setting a value for the supplied key

values.description: Setting multi values for the supplied key

block.description: A list of settings associated to the project
Provides a Sonarqube Project resource. This can be used to create and manage Sonarqube Project.

name.description: The name you want the main branch to have.

project.description: Key of the project. Maximum length 400. All letters, digits, dash, underscore, period or colon.

block.description: Provides a Sonarqube Project main branch resource. This can be used to create and manage a Sonarqube Projects main branch.

copy_from.description: Name of an existing Quality Gate to copy from.

is_default.description: When set to true this Quality Gate is set as default.

name.description: The name of the Quality Gate to create. Maximum length 100.

metric.description:
Condition metric.

  Only metrics of the following types are allowed:

  - INT
  - MILLISEC
  - RATING
  - WORK_DUR
  - FLOAT
  - PERCENT
  - LEVEL.

  The following metrics are forbidden:

  - alert_status
  - security_hotspots
  - new_security_hotspots

op.description: Condition operator. Possible values are: LT and GT

threshold.description: Condition error threshold (For ratings: A=1, B=2, C=3, D=4)

block.description: A list of conditions that the gate uses.
Provides a Sonarqube Quality Gate resource. This can be used to create and manage Sonarqube Quality Gates and their Conditions.

gatename.description: The name of the Quality Gate

projectkey.description: Key of the project. Maximum length 400. All letters, digits, dash, underscore, period or colon.

block.description: Provides a Sonarqube Quality Gate Project association resource. This can be used to associate a Quality Gate to a Project

gatename.description: The name of the Quality Gate

group_name.description: The name of the Group to associate. Either `group_name` or `login_name` should be provided.

login_name.description: The name of the User to associate. Either `group_name` or `login_name` should be provided.

block.description:
Provides a Sonarqube Quality Gate Usergroup association resource. This can be used to associate a Quality Gate to an User or to a Group.
The feature is available on SonarQube 9.2 or newer.

is_default.description: When set to true this will make the added Quality Profile default

key.description: ID of the Sonarqube Quality Profile

language.description: Quality profile language. Must be one of "cs", "css", "flex", "go", "java", "js", "jsp", "kotlin", "php", "py", "ruby", "scala", "ts", "vbnet", "web", "xml"

name.description: The name of the Quality Profile to create. Maximum length 100

parent.description: When a parent is provided the quality profile will inherit it's rules

block.description: Provides a Sonarqube Quality Profile resource. This can be used to create and manage Sonarqube Quality Profiles.

key.description: Quality Profile key. Can be obtained through api/qualityprofiles/search

params.description: Parameters as semi-colon list of =, for example 'params=key1=v1;key2=v2' (Only for custom rule)

reset.description:
Reset severity and parameters of activated rule. Set the values defined on parent profile or from rule default values.
  - Possible values true false yes no (Default false)

severity.description:
Severity. Ignored if parameter reset is true.
  - Possible values - INFO, MINOR, MAJOR, CRITICAL, BLOCKER

block.description: Provides a Sonarqube Rules resource. This can be used to manage Sonarqube rules.

language.description: Quality profile language. Must be a langauge in this list https://next.sonarqube.com/sonarqube/web_api/api/languages/list

block.description: Provides a Sonarqube Quality Profile Project association resource. This can be used to associate a Quality Profile to a Project

custom_key.description: key of the custom rule should only contain : a-z, 0-9, \_

params.description:
Parameters as semi-colon list of =, for example 'params=key1=v1;key2=v2' (Only for custom rule)
  - parameter order: expression=value;filePattern=value;message=value

prevent_reactivation.description:
If set to true and if the rule has been deactivated (status 'REMOVED'), a status 409 will be returned
  - Possible values - true, false, yes, no

severity.description:
Rule severity
  - Possible values - INFO, MINOR, MAJOR, CRITICAL, BLOCKER

status.description:
Rule status
  - Possible values - BETA, DEPRECATED, READY, REMOVED
  - Default value - READY

template_key.description:
Key of the template rule in order to create a custom rule (mandatory for custom rule)
  - [Example values](https://docs.sonarqube.org/latest/user-guide/rules/#header-4)

type.description:
Rule type
  - Possible values - CODE_SMELL, BUG, VULNERABILITY, SECURITY_HOTSPOT

block.description: Provides a Sonarqube Rules resource. This can be used to manage Sonarqube rules.

field_values.description: Setting field values for the supplied key

value.description: Setting value. To reset a value, please use the reset web service.

values.description: Setting multi values for the supplied key

block.description: Provides a Sonarqube Settings resource. This can be used to manage Sonarqube settings.

email.description: The email of the User to create.

is_local.description: `True` if the User should be of type `local`. Defaults to `true`.

login_name.description: The login name of the User to create. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

name.description: The name of the User to create. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

password.description: The password of User to create. This is only used if the user is of type `local`.

block.description: Provides a Sonarqube User resource. This can be used to manage Sonarqube Users.

external_identity.description: The identifier of the User used by the Authentication Provider. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

external_provider.description: The key of the Authentication Provider. The Authentication Provider must be activated on Sonarqube. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

login_name.description: The login name of the User to update. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

block.description:
Updates the _external identity_ of a _non local_ Sonarqube User. This can be used to set the _Identity Provider_ which should be used to
authenticate a specific user.

The Sonarqube API currently does not provide an endpoint to read the _external identity_ setting of an user.

expiration_date.description: The expiration date of the token being generated, in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD). If not set, default to no expiration.

login_name.description: The login name of the User for which the token should be created. If not set, the token is created for the authenticated user. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

name.description: The name of the Token to create. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

project_key.description: The key of the only project that can be analyzed by the PROJECT_ANALYSIS TOKEN being created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

type.description: The kind of Token to create. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Possible values are USER_TOKEN, GLOBAL_ANALYSIS_TOKEN, or PROJECT_ANALYSIS_TOKEN. Defaults to USER_TOKEN. If set to PROJECT_ANALYSIS_TOKEN, then the project_key must also be specified.

block.description: Provides a Sonarqube User token resource. This can be used to manage Sonarqube User tokens.

name.description: The name of the webhook to create. This will be displayed in the Sonarqube administration console.

project.description: The key of the project that will own the webhook.

secret.description: The secret to send with the event payload.

url.description: The URL to send event payloads to. This must begin with either `https://` or `http://`.

block.description: Provides a Sonarqube Webhook resource. This can be used to manage Sonarqube webhooks.
Use this data source to get a Sonarqube Group resource

regexp.description: The regular expression used to populate the portfolio. Only active when `selection_mode` is `REGEXP`

selection_mode.description: How the Portfolio is populated. Possible values are `NONE`, `MANUAL`, `TAGS`, `REGEXP` or `REST`. [See docs](https://docs.sonarqube.org/9.8/project-administration/managing-portfolios/#populating-portfolios) for how Portfolio population works

tags.description: The list of tags used to populate the Portfolio. Only active when `selection_mode` is `TAGS`

block.description: Use this data source to get a Sonarqube portfolio resource

project.description: The project key of the project

block.description: Use this data source to get a Sonarqube project resource

name.description: The name of the Quality Gate.

block.description: Use this data source to get a Sonarqube qualitygate resource

key.description: The key of the Quality Profile

name.description: The name of the Quality Profile

block.description: Use this data source to get a Sonarqube qualityprofile resource

key.description: The key of the sonarqube rule. Should be <repo>:<name>. https://next.sonarqube.com/sonarqube/web_api/api/rules?query=api%2Frules%2Fcreate

block.description: Use this data source to get a Sonarqube rule resource

login_name.description: The login name of the user

block.description: Use this data source to get a Sonarqube User resource
